Merge two or more gtsummary regression objects

tbl_merge.Rd

Merges two or more tbl_regression or tbl_uvregression objects and adds appropriate spanning headers.

tbl_merge(tbls, tab_spanner = paste0(c("Model "), 1:length(tbls)))

Arguments

tbls

list of gtsummary regression objects
tab_spanner

Spanning headers. Character vector with same length as tbls

Example Output

See also

tbl_stack

Other tbl_regression tools: add_global_p.tbl_regression, add_nevent.tbl_regression, bold_italicize_labels_levels, inline_text.tbl_regression, sort_p.tbl_regression, tab_style_bold_p.tbl_regression, tbl_regression, tbl_stack

Other tbl_uvregression tools: add_global_p.tbl_uvregression, add_nevent.tbl_uvregression, add_q.tbl_uvregression, bold_italicize_labels_levels, inline_text.tbl_uvregression, sort_p.tbl_uvregression, tab_style_bold_p.tbl_uvregression, tbl_uvregression

Examples

library(survival)
t1 <-
  glm(response ~ trt + grade + age, trial, family = binomial) %>%
  tbl_regression(
    label = list(trt = "Treatment", grade = "Grade", age = "Age"),
    exponentiate = TRUE
  )
t2 <-
  coxph(Surv(ttdeath, death) ~ trt + grade + age, trial) %>%
  tbl_regression(
    label = list(trt = "Treatment", grade = "Grade", age = "Age"),
    exponentiate = TRUE
  )
tbl_merge_ex <-
  tbl_merge(
    tbls = list(t1, t2),
    tab_spanner = c("Tumor Response", "Time to Death")
  )
